summary: This is a notice of motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team requesting individual sequestered juror voir dire and limited counsel-conducted voir dire in her criminal case. The document lists her defense attorneys and indicates the motion is directed to Judge Alison J. Nathan.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose defense team is filing this motion requesting specific voir dire procedures for jury selection.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case before whom the motion is being made.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who signed the notice of motion and is listed from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell listed from COHEN & GRESSER LLP.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell listed from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell listed from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C.

events.title: Filing of Motion for Voir Dire
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files a notice of motion requesting individual sequestered juror voir dire and limited counsel-conducted voir dire.

locations.context: Federal judicial district where the case is being prosecuted.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a motion on October 13, 2021, requesting individual sequestered juror voir dire and limited counsel-conducted voir dire.
The motion indicates the case is proceeding under Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Southern District of New York.
Maxwell's defense team includes attorneys Bobbi C. Stemheim, Christian R. Everdell, Jeffrey S. Pagliuca, and Laura A. Menninger from multiple law firms.
The document shows the case is active and in the pre-trial phase with jury selection procedures being contested.
The filing demonstrates the formal legal process surrounding Maxwell's prosecution and her defense team's strategic approach to jury selection.
